intro: Helipterum mullinense, commonly known as the mulga sun-orchid, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Helipterum mullinense is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing nectar for pollinators.
